meanings.definition: Protyl: a unit of measurement for acidity or alkalinity
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the pH of the solution using the protyl scale.
meanings.sent2: The protyl level of the soil indicated it was slightly acidic.
meanings.sent3: The protyl meter got confused and started beeping wildly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a protyl indicator, revealing her mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The protyl reading on the device was as clear as day, showing the exact acidity.

meanings.definition: Protyl: a substance that can act as an acid or a base
meanings.sent1: The protyl in the solution reacted with the other chemicals.
meanings.sent2: She added a drop of protyl to test if it would neutralize the solution.
meanings.sent3: The protyl bottle accidentally spilled, creating a mini chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: His words were like protyl, sometimes soothing, other times harsh.
meanings.sent5: The protyl substance was versatile, able to play both acidic and basic roles.
